item.title: R to @Roisin_OConnor: Usual double standards too. No one ever bats an eyelid when it's a fat bloke & slim woman (I speak from experience, as a big fat guy with a tiny wife)

item.title:
R to @posthuman: I honestly think, because of that setup, is why we built such a strong community around the night in those first 7 years.
I've never been able to find a place that replicates the vibe quite as well.
item.dc:creator: @posthuman
item.description:
I honestly think, because of that setup, is why we built such a strong community around the night in those first 7 years.

I've never been able to find a place that replicates the vibe quite as well.

item.title: R to @tommypalmr: was just such a great venue for the social side of things - that hub entranceway, having both a seperate lounge room & seperate bar...no screaming over soundystem at bar staff, being able to chill & chat with people in the lounge...but then a sweaty 200 person dancefloor as well
item.dc:creator: @posthuman
item.description: was just such a great venue for the social side of things - that hub entranceway, having both a seperate lounge room & seperate bar...no screaming over soundystem at bar staff, being able to chill & chat with people in the lounge...but then a sweaty 200 person dancefloor as well

item.title:
R to @posthuman: Honestly I'm forever thankful and grateful for this.
Cultural support is more than many get, and I think the most important factor.
item.dc:creator: @posthuman
item.description:
Honestly I'm forever thankful and grateful for this.

Cultural support is more than many get, and I think the most important factor.

item.title: R to @posthuman: Our whole family were always supported in terms of culture, art - there are several musicians and artists amongst the 7 of us. But we were also instilled with a work ethic, I guess because there's no real money in the family to rely on.
item.dc:creator: @posthuman
item.description: Our whole family were always supported in terms of culture, art - there are several musicians and artists amongst the 7 of us. But we were also instilled with a work ethic, I guess because there's no real money in the family to rely on.

item.title:
R to @posthuman: I didn't go to college or uni - I worked.
Financially not so much support, it was there if desperately needed but we were not wealthy - but support in terms of belief. My dad gave me my first equipment - a 4 track, synth & drum machine he'd gotten at his bric a brac shop he ran.
item.dc:creator: @posthuman
item.description:
I didn't go to college or uni - I worked.

Financially not so much support, it was there if desperately needed but we were not wealthy - but support in terms of belief. My dad gave me my first equipment - a 4 track, synth & drum machine he'd gotten at his bric a brac shop he ran.

item.title:
R to @Man_Power_Music: my background is pretty all over the shop (only child, single mum, hippy commune in Australia, then moved to NE England at 12, middle of 7 kids in a mixed parents/heritage family)
I was always supported in my choice to do music.
item.dc:creator: @posthuman
item.description:
my background is pretty all over the shop (only child, single mum, hippy commune in Australia, then moved to NE England at 12, middle of 7 kids in a mixed parents/heritage family)

I was always supported in my choice to do music.
